opinions.content: When on a date, the person who initiated the date should pay, regardless of gender. Splitting the bill signals that the date went poorly and should be avoided.

Most people who claim 'the book is better than the movie' are lying and just trying to sound intellectual. While books are often superior to their film adaptations, this blanket statement is frequently made by people who want to appear cultured rather than those who genuinely prefer the written version.

Not everyone is a winner, and the culture of participation trophies is fundamentally harmful. Teaching children that they're winners regardless of effort or outcome leaves them ill-equipped to handle real-world setbacks. Sometimes little Billy needs to learn that life isn't all sunshine and rainbows.

Social media activism accomplishes very little beyond inflating egos and feeding savior complexes. It creates the illusion of meaningful action while rarely translating into real-world change that actually helps people.

You shouldn't unfollow people on social media simply because of political disagreements. Surrounding yourself with an echo chamber of identical viewpoints stunts intellectual growth and contributes to societal polarization.

Aliens are real and have likely visited Earth, but found us uninteresting. In a universe this vast, intelligent life must exist elsewhere, and with billions of years for civilizations to develop before humans appeared, they've probably already discovered us and moved on to more fascinating worlds.

If you stand for everything, you stand for nothing. I have no respect for people who agree with every cause and avoid taking firm positions. It's better to make a few enemies while standing for something meaningful than to be universally liked while believing in nothing.

There should be no money in politics whatsoever. Campaign contributions should be banned entirely, and every candidate who gathers sufficient petition signatures should receive equal government funding for their campaign.

People should start posting mundane, ordinary moments on social media instead of just highlight reels. The constant stream of curated happiness creates unrealistic expectations and doesn't reflect the reality of human experience.

Don't attend events out of politeness if you genuinely don't want to be there. If you're not enthusiastic about coming, I'd rather you stay homeâ€”your reluctant presence diminishes the experience for everyone involved.

Brand loyalty is a scam that inflates prices and prevents consumers from discovering superior alternatives. Blind allegiance to brands often means paying premium prices for inferior products while ignoring better options.

Countries that complain about overtourism while depending on tourism revenue are fundamentally ungrateful. If tourism is your primary economic driver, you have no right to resent the very visitors who sustain your economy.
iPad tipping prompts should be illegal, or at minimum shouldn't include preset percentage options. Why should I tip 22% on a microwaved pretzel when no actual service was provided?

People should eliminate their lawns entirely. These ecological deserts waste water, require harmful chemicals, and provide zero environmental benefit while consuming countless hours of maintenance time.
You should not start a podcast. The market is oversaturated with mediocre content, and unless you have genuine expertise or a truly unique perspective, you're just adding to the noise.

Celebrities should be allowed to participate in political discussions without being automatically discredited. Having fame doesn't invalidate someone's right to express political opinions or eliminate their capacity for informed commentary.

We should be extremely cautious about AI chatbots and romantic relationships with artificial intelligence. Society is heading straight toward the dystopian scenario depicted in 'Her,' and this technological intimacy is deeply concerning.

Local politics matter significantly more than national politics for most people's daily lives. Your city council decisions affect your immediate environment far more than federal legislation, yet people obsess over national politics while ignoring local elections.

Suburbs should be eliminated in favor of denser, more sustainable urban planning. Suburban sprawl is environmentally destructive, economically inefficient, and creates car-dependent communities that isolate residents from meaningful social interaction.

There should be daily limits on AI usage to prevent over-dependence and maintain human cognitive abilities. Unlimited access to AI assistance risks atrophying our problem-solving skills and critical thinking capabilities.
